channel.title: Timeline of the City's History: 1923 on Homicide in Chicago 1870-1930
channel.description: Recent content in Timeline of the City's History: 1923 on Homicide in Chicago 1870-1930

item.title: 'The Busiest Corner of the World'
item.description: A view of the ‘Busiest Corner of the World,’ State and Madison Streets, showing Mandel Brothers, Chas. A, Stevens & Bros., The Columbus Memorial Building and Marshall Field & Company. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year

item.title: Looking North on Michigan Avenue from the Art Institute
item.description: The Stop and Go system is proven by the pictures a great success. Lorado Taft’s Great Lakes Fountain is shown on the south facade of the Institute. The Buckingham Elevator visible in the distance is a relic of the Great Fire of 1871. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year

item.title: Policeman Andrew Wodarczyk
item.description: Policeman Andrew Wodarczyk standing at the front door of 121 East 30th Street Chicago Daily News, Inc., photographer. Created/Published 1923 Summary Image of policeman Andrew Wodarczyk, in uniform, standing at the front door of 121 East 30th Street after a vice raid in Chicago, Illinois. Notes This photonegative taken by a Chicago Daily News photographer may have been published in the newspaper. Cite as: DN-0075589, Chicago Daily News negatives collection, Chicago Historical Society.

item.title: Policeman Andrew Wodarczyk, Sign
item.description: Policeman Andrew Wodarczyk standing and pointing at a sign at the rear entrance of 121 East 30th Street Chicago Daily News, Inc., photographer. Created/Published 1923 Summary Image of policeman Andrew Wodarczyk, in uniform, standing and pointing at a sign at the rear entrance of 121 East 30th Street after a vice raid in Chicago, Illinois. This sign reads: Venereal Disease Keep Out. Notes This photonegative taken by a Chicago Daily News photographer may have been published in the newspaper.

item.title: State Street
item.description: State Street, looking north from Washington Street. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year

item.title: Yellow Kid Weil
item.description: Yellow Kid Weil sitting in a room Chicago Daily News, Inc., photographer. Created/Published 1923 Summary Half-length portrait of the infamous con artist ‘Yellow Kid’ Weil sitting in a room in Chicago, Illinois. Notes This photonegative taken by a Chicago Daily News photographer may have been published in the newspaper. Cite as: DN-0070628, Chicago Daily News negatives collection, Chicago Historical Society. Reproduction Number: DN-0070628 Digital ID: ichicdn n070628 ������������ Other images from this year
